caption: Figure 1: We propose ConceptMaster, a Multi-Concept Video Customization (MCVC) method that could create high-quality and concept-consistent customized videos based on given multiple reference images without additional test-time tuning. Our ConceptMaster is capable of handling diverse customized scenarios, including but not limited to 1) multiple persons, 2) persons with livings, 3) persons with stuffs, 4) multiple livings, 5) livings with stuffs and 6) persons with both livings and stuffs.
description: ConceptMaster is a new method for creating high-quality, consistent videos with multiple concepts from reference images, without any test-time tuning.  It handles various scenarios, including multiple people, people with animals, people with objects, multiple animals, animals with objects, and combinations of people, animals, and objects.

caption: Figure 2: Directly applying single-concept method cannot handle the MCVC task, while the naive solution by combining multi-concept image generation and image-to-video generation models can also hardly create satisfactory customized results.
description: This figure illustrates the limitations of applying single-concept video generation methods and simple combinations of multi-concept image generation with image-to-video models to the task of Multi-Concept Video Customization (MCVC).  The single-concept approach fails to effectively handle multiple concepts, leading to inconsistent or inaccurate video generation.  The naive combined approach, although using multiple concepts, does not produce satisfactory results because the combination method does not effectively address the challenge of identity decoupling and concept conflation which are common issues within MCVC.

caption: Figure 3: Overview of the framework of our proposed ConceptMaster.
description: This figure presents a detailed overview of the ConceptMaster framework. It illustrates the process of multi-concept video customization, starting from user-provided text captions and multiple reference images. The framework incorporates visual and textual embeddings, leveraging a decouple attention module (DAM) to integrate these, and employs a multi-concept injector for seamless integration into the diffusion model.  The output is a high-quality customized video that accurately reflects the specified concepts.
